com.aionemu.commons.log4j
Class ThrowableAsMessageLogger

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.log4j.Category
      org.apache.log4j.Logger
          com.aionemu.commons.log4j.ThrowableAsMessageLogger
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.log4j.spi.AppenderAttachable
public class ThrowableAsMessageLogger
extends org.apache.log4j.Logger

This class is designed to handle situations when log4J was called like:

 org.apache.log4j.Logger#log(Throwable)

In such cases this logger will take message from throwable and set it as message. Throwable will be threated as real throwable, so no stacktraces would be lost.

Author:
SoulKeeper

Method Detail

forcedLog

protected void forcedLog(java.lang.String fqcn,
                         org.apache.log4j.Priority level,
                         java.lang.Object message,
                         java.lang.Throwable t)
This method checks if message is instance of throwbale and throwable is null. If it is so it will move message to throwable and set localized message of throwable as message of the log record

Overrides:
forcedLog in class org.apache.log4j.Category
Parameters:
fqcn - fully qualified class name, it would be used to get the line of call
level - level of log record
message - message of log record
t - throwable, if any present
